definition: top-notch (colloquial)/to push oneself to the front
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize
erhua variant of 拔尖[ba2 jian1]

sentences.english: With a scream of braking, the life of Yingzi flew up gently.
sentences.chinese: 随着一阵拔尖的煞车声，樱子的一生轻轻地飞了起来。

sentences.english: Started double top construction, cultivating outstanding innovative talents.
sentences.chinese: 全面启动“双一流”建设，培养拔尖创新人才。

sentences.english: With the breaks screeching, Yingzi's life flied in the air gently.
sentences.chinese: 随着一阵拔尖的煞车声，樱子的一生轻轻地飞了起来。

sentences.english: With the squeak of stopping the car, the life to Ying just fly up lightly.
sentences.chinese: 随着一阵拔尖的煞车声，樱子的一生轻轻地飞了起来。

sentences.english: With a screech of brakes, Ouko flied lightly and descended slowly on the clammy road like a night butterfly.
sentences.chinese: 随着一阵拔尖的煞车声，樱子的一生轻轻地飞了起来。

sentences.english: The peanuts they grow are top-notch.
sentences.chinese: 他们种的花生是拔尖的。

sentences.english: She graduated from medical school near the top of her class.
sentences.chinese: 她是以她班级最拔尖的学生从医学院毕业了。

sentences.english: With a screech of an abrupt stop, Yingzi's life flew off softly.
sentences.chinese: 随着一阵拔尖的煞车声，樱子的一生轻轻地飞了起来。

sentences.english: The cream of the class is made up of the best students.
sentences.chinese: 这些拔尖的学生成了班级的精华。

definition: erhua variant of 拔尖[ba2 jian1]
reckoned to be first or second best (idiom)/one of the very best/to list one by one
erhua variant of 頂尖|顶尖[ding3 jian1]
best of its kind/cream of the crop
to overemphasize some topic (at the expense of others)/overdoing it/to go overboard
a crane in a flock of chicken (idiom); way above the common/manifestly superior
